TestDescription.name: Parallels Plesk SQL injection vulnerability
TestDescription.Description:
Parallels Plesk Panel is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the Server Administration Panel using specially-crafted input to a PHP script, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database. [break][break]
Plesk versions that are affected by the vulnerability: [ul] [li]Plesk for Linux / Windows 7.x[/li] [li]Plesk for Linux / Windows 8.x[/li] [li]Plesk for Linux / Windows 9.x[/li] [li]Plesk for Linux / Windows 10.0 - 10.3.1[/li] [/ul]
TestDescription.Impact: An anonymous attacker can remotely compromise Plesk server.
TestDescription.Recommendation: Update to the latest version of Parallels Plesk or install the Micro-Updates provided by the vendor. Check Web references for more information.

Reference.database: [FIX] Older Plesk Versions - Remote vulnerability in Plesk Panel (CVE-2012-1557)
